203 - 04 Dec 2023 03:35PM - +263 78 008 5885: 2. Please elaborate on the difference between Rights and Duties and give a further explanation of the difference in human rights and civil rights.  Rights are things that you are legally entitled to, while duties are things that you are legally obligated to do. Rights are often seen as positive while duties are seen as negative.However, both are important in creating a just and fair society.For example the right to free speech is seen as positive because it allows people to express themselves freely.Whilst the duty to pay taxes is seen as negative as it requires people to give up their money.But both are necessary for a functioning society. As for the difference between human rights and civil rights, human rights are considered to be universal as they apply to all people regardless of nationality or citizenship.Civil rights on the other hand are specific to a particular country or jurisdiction and may vary from place to place.  3.What is the difference between a prosecutor and an attorney?  There are a few key differences between prosecutors and attorneys. First, prosecutors work for the government, while attorneys can work for either the government or private clients. Second, prosecutors have the responsibility of deciding whether or not to press charges against someone, while attorneys defend their clients against those charges. Also, prosecutors have the burden of proof in a criminal case, meaning they must prove beyond a reasonable doubt that the defendant is guilty. On the other hand, attorneys have the responsibility of presenting a strong defense for their clients. Certainly! Another key difference between prosecutors and attorneys is their approach to a case. Prosecutors have the goal of obtaining a conviction, while attorneys have the goal of protecting their client's rights and interests. This often leads to different strategies being used by each side. For example, a prosecutor may try to build a strong case against the defendant by using evidence and testimony to prove guilt, while an attorney may try to challenge the evidence or discredit the testimony in order to create reasonable doubt.  4. Which branch of law are you most interested in persuing civil, corporate or criminal and why?  I'm interested in persuing civil law. Civil law is the branch of law which deals with non criminal disputes between individuals, business or organisations. These disputes include things like branch of contract, personal injury, property damage and more.lm interested in this branch of law as l would help to resolve these disputes.Also civil law is a very broad area of law that covers a wide range of topics. This means that they are many different career paths that can be persued after graduation.Also civil law is often less adversarial than other areas of law, which can make it more enjoyable and rewarding field to work. It is often less stressful than other areas of law since there is usually less at stake in civil cases . Finally, civil law can be a very intellectually stimulating field since it often involves complex legal issues and problem solving.  5.  What skills do you believe you have that will make you a successful lawyer, please elaborate with an example.  First,l believe that l have skills that will make me a successful lawyer since I have strong communication skills.It is highlighted as l was the Projects Officer of the Eastern Eagles Rovers Scouts Club at my school. I was the one who was responsible for presenting club proposals to the school stuff through meetings which were successful.Also lm good at problem solving and at one point there were few students at our school who were unable to register for their final exams because of financial problems,l was able to come up with an idea to conduct a short term income generating project and as a club we were able to support them financially.

191 - 03 Dec 2023 04:02PM - +263 78 871 0042: Question 5 Accounting focuses on recording and presenting all financial statements and transactions. In contrast,auditing focuses on verifying the accuracy of the financial statements and judging if the financial statements genuinely represent the financial position of the business. Accounting is about compiling financial data a d crafting reports whereas, auditing is about reviewing financial information to ensure accuracy. Accounting is preparing financial documents, monitoring day to day bookkeeping for a firm's operations,and preparing and filing tax forms whilst auditing is verifying the accuracy of financial statements and tax filings and search for clues as to why some figure don't quite add up. Accounting is a daily process of recording financial transactions whilst auditing is a periodic process that focuses on ensuring legality of financial statements. In accounting, there is consultation of clients about how they can improve their financial position based on the data but in auditing,simply report on whether or not the data is compliant and correct. In accounting there are deliveries of  income statements and balance sheets whilst in auditing there ris only delivery of an audit report. I'm accounting,reporting is done to employers or clients whilst in auditing, reporting is done to shareholders or legal entities. The scope of accounting is determined by the client or employer whilst the scope of auditing is determined by the law. Accounting covers all transactions, records and statements having financial implications,while auditing mainly covers final financial statements and records.

58 - 04 Dec 2023 04:44PM - Arshita: *B.A. (Hons.) in Sociology* is an undergraduate program that deals with various aspects of social behavior and its consequence on modern society. Sociology is a branch of study which investigates multiple aspects of society and social behavior which helps them to do social work. A Bachelor's degree in Sociology teaches the fundamental concepts related to the structure of society, organization of society, and how humans interact within these constructs. The basic subject matter of Sociology concerns itself with topics related to family structure, global warfare, religious cults, social class, race, and gender, etc.  *Course Outline*  This program provides you with an understanding of core traditions and contemporary developments in sociological thinking and research. The theories and methods we explore enable us to examine the character and workings of the social institutions that govern peoples lives and encourage us to critically question the social values we live by. This program provides you with an understanding of core traditions and contemporary developments in sociological thinking and research. The theories and methods we explore enable us to examine the character and workings of the social institutions that govern peoples lives, and encourage us to critically question the social values we live by.  *Career Opportunities*  This degree course enables the students to go for various Sociology related jobs such as in industry, commerce, the NHS, education authorities, further and higher education, and charitable, counseling, and voluntary organizations. One can go for higher degree programs in respective subjects for further research work in Sociology.  Opportunities also exist for sociology graduates in the civil service and graduate management training schemes. Sociology graduates work with a varied and diverse client group during the course of their career.  *Bachelor of Arts in Sociology* includes a number of compulsory subjects. Along with that, the students will also have to choose from a number of elective subjects. The elective subjects may differ from college to college.  The subjects of study in the *BA Sociology course* curriculum are tabulated below:  Module 1: Introducing Sociology Module 2: Introducing India Module 3: Classical Sociological Thinkers I Module 4: Social Interaction and Social Relationships Module 5: Classical Sociological Thinkers II Module 6: Body, Culture and Cultural Contestations Module 7: Social Institutions I Module 8: Social Theory I Module 9: Social Institutions II Module 10: Social Theory II Module 11: Research Method I Module 12: Social Stratification Module 13: Research Method II Module 14: Social Challenges and Movements Module 15: Change, Development, Globalization Module 16: Dissertation  _*BA Sociology: Elective Subjects*_ Some of the important elective papers include:  Sociology of Development	Sociology of Indian Society Principles of Sociology	Social Psychology Economic Sociology	Political Sociology Sociology of Education	Sociology of Mass Communication Social Anthropology	Life Skill Education Women Studies	Sociology of Mass Media

27 - 04 Dec 2023 02:42PM - Arshita: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
28 - 04 Dec 2023 02:42PM - Arshita: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program. We are associated with more than 200 schools in Zimbabwe. Some of the most elite Schools in Zimbabawe example in Harare we are collaborated with St. Dominics Chishawasha, Dominican Convent, Christ Ministries and many others. In Manicaland we have a total of 18 Schools to name a few St. Davids Girls Bonda, Hartzell High, First Class, First Choice and so on.  Chipinge we have Chibuwe High School, you would be happy to know that the DEOs of Mutare and Chipinge have their kids under the Edoofa Scholarship. Masvingo we have 24 Schools collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools example Pamushana, St. Antonys, Reformed Church Gutu, Zaka High and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita Madam Makomeke.We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central and East) Province, Midlands Province.  Last but not the Least we also have Schools from Bulawayo and Matebaland South associated with Edoofa. Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo adds a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in a span of 14 years.   The Schools, Institutions and Educationists who have made efforts to train the students for this prestigious Scholarship Program are also the Authorized Designatories of EDOOFA in Zimbabawe. We have Mr. Shorwi Kawadza (Retd. Headmaster Hartzell), Mr. Charles Jerera (Retd. Ministry of Education), Ms. Christina Rockson (Founder and Principal of Hilltop Christian College in SA) who have shown relentless efforts to guide students on the right path to success.EDOOFA boasts a proud students and parents community of more than 2500+ Zimbabwean who are happy with the quality of education and the employability outcomes.

204 - 04 Dec 2023 02:58PM - Arshita: I do understand and appreciate the willingness of your family to invest in your career, did you manage to compare the cost of education in Zimbabwe with that through the Edoofa Scholarship Program?
206 - 04 Dec 2023 03:12PM - Arshita: Our Senior Academician was in Zimbabwe for 4 months this year and let me highlight the importance of this opportunity for Zimbabwean students. I want you to think about this situation, where you are studying at UZ. The Tuition fee at UZ ranges from $1000-$1200 per annum with hikes most of the years. The living expenses in Zimbabwe are much more costly than in India. Even the staple diet sadza costs $1 per meal. So you have to spend around $3 per or more per day for meals. A taxi ride for a short distance costs $1, Wi-Fi costs $120 per month, the living rents are high with hikes and the unemployment rates are increasing. Many students work at petrol pumps, markets, selling SIM cards etc after graduation. You might have observed this. All in all, students studying in Zimbabwe have informed us they have to meet an expense of about $3000 or more per annum.
207 - 04 Dec 2023 03:12PM - Arshita: At the same time, Edoofians are studying here in India at a cost much less than that of Zimbabwe and even self-sponsoring their education through the Earn While You Learn Program. We also ensure they develop employability skills so that they are job-ready by the time they graduate. I believe you are looking forward to such an opportunity for your career, aren't you?

18 - 04 Dec 2023 04:04PM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
19 - 04 Dec 2023 04:04PM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denotes the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
20 - 04 Dec 2023 04:04PM - Gurvinder: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program just in the last year. We are associated with more than 200 schools with more than 250 Headmaster, Chairman SDC, and Educationists that are associated with EDOOFA. *Our associate partner, Mr Shorwi Kawadza*, is a reputed Educationalist from Zimbabwe and is the Principal of Hartzell High School. *Hartzell High School*, Mutare has collaborated with us for the past Four Years from which more than 80 students have enrolled and arrived in India already. The Child of the DEO, Manicaland *Sir Abson Mapfumo* is a part of the Edoofa Scholarship Program. *United College of Education*, Bulawayo the best college in Bulawayo is Associated with EDOOFA, and Respected *Sir Adam Luthuli* has her daughter enrolled under the Edoofa Scholarship Program. Similarly, the Daughter of Mr.N.M Maposa, Headmaster of Chibuwe High, the son of Ms Christina Rockson, The Principal of Hilltop Christian High School, South Africa, and the child of *Mrs. Aleta Makomeke*, DEO at Masvingo province are Edoofians and we have many more success stories from St. David's Bonda High, St. Alberts, Christ Ministries, Advent Hope Academy, Nhowe Mission, Nyazura High, First Class High, etc.
21 - 04 Dec 2023 04:05PM - Gurvinder: I feel you too are looking for something like this for yourself so that just like these students you can become independent and start taking a little bit of responsibility towards your higher education by yourself and help your parents, reduce the financial burden, isn't it?

75 - 04 Dec 2023 12:32PM - Gurvinder: *Bachelor of Arts - Bachelor of Legislative Law* calls for the candidates with attention to detail, reasoning and critical judgment skills. The students having an ability to draft formal documents with precision are perfect for this course. This course is made for the students who are able to formulate sound arguments, can think laterally and possess problem solving skills.
76 - 04 Dec 2023 12:32PM - Gurvinder: A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are:  *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations.  The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates.  *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their clients perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court.  *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor.  *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job.  *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding.  A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

21 - 04 Dec 2023 11:45AM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!

195 - 04 Dec 2023 04:58PM - Pallika Edoofa: Indeed   If I have to help you explain, how the Earn While You Learn Program helps a student make higher education affordable and comparable to Local Universities. 46 - 04 Dec 2023 07:12PM - Pallika Edoofa: *The Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4,000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5,000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
47 - 04 Dec 2023 07:12PM - Pallika Edoofa: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2500 students enrolled in the program. We are associated with more than 200 schools in Zimbabwe. Some of the most elite Schools in Zimbabwe example in Harare we are collaborated with St. Dominics Chishawasha, Dominican Convent, Christ Ministries, and many others. In Manicaland, we have a total of 18 Schools to name a few St. Davids Girls Bonda, Hartzell High, First Class, First Choice, and so on.  Chipinge we have Chibuwe High School, You would be happy to know that the DEOs of Mutare and Chipinge have their kids under the Edoofa Scholarship. Masvingo has 24 Schools that collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools example Pamushana, St. Antonys, Reformed Church Gutu, Zaka High, and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita Madam Makomeke. We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central, and East) Province, Midlands Province.  Last but not least we also have Schools from Bulawayo and Matebaland South associated with Edoofa. Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo add a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in a span of 14 years.    The Schools, Institutions, and Educationists who have made efforts to train the students for this prestigious Scholarship Program are also the Authorized designers of EDOOFA in Zimbabwe. We have Mr. Shorwi Kawadza (Retd. Headmaster Hartzell), Mr. Charles Jerera (Retd. Ministry of Education), and Ms. Christina Rockson (Founder and Principal of Hilltop Christian College in SA) who have shown relentless efforts to guide students on the right path to success.EDOOFA boasts a proud Zimbabwean students and parents community of more than 2500 from Zimbabwe who are happy with the quality of education and the employability outcomes.  *I believe you are looking forward to such an opportunity for your career, aren't you?*

427 - 02 Dec 2023 01:49PM - Sahil Edoofa: Melyndah's admission is for August 2025 Intake. Let me share with you for all the applicants who would be traveling to India for 2025 year's academic intake. Their application would utilize this time duration in the following ways  *1. The student would be working on their Earn While You Learn Program:-* Having a head start that too of more than 20 months helps a student have a better hold in their EWYL Journey. During these years, one thing which I have personally witnessed is that a student who have better understanding of their EWYL projects and the ones who earn higher amount of scholarship credits every month, are the ones who always had this headstart in their career.  Giving you an example, *Persistance Muza* the student who earned over $4000 worth or scholarship credits, became a part of the Edoofa Program for his August 2022 intake in August 2021. The student earned more than $1900 worth of scholarship credits before even coming to India and within just a couple of months after arriving he has now earned an additional $2100 worth of scholarship credits, which has ensured his parents that he can cater for his annual fee after the scholarship through his hard work in the Earn While You Learn Program itself.  This happened only because students like him had time to understand the projects and assignments while being in their home country.  *2. Parents would be communicating with the Admission's Team:-* Having ample amount of time in hand, not just benefits the student but actually helps the parent as well to plan better for their child's international education journey. Therefore to utilize this for your advantage, you would be interacting with the admissions team and start preparing for your child's international journey for 2025. This means that if you are supposed to start saving for your child's annual fee after scholarship, this becomes the right time since admission officers would brief you on a regular basis regarding how you should plan for the finances, if you face any challenges you could get the same addressed since you have time before your child finally travels.  *3,  Having the benefit of the Community:-* This part doesn't just benefits the student but actually benefits the entire family. The moment student becomes a part of the Edoofa Program he/she starts interacting with other students who are a part of the community, this helps the student to connect with toppers of their fields, students who have scored a perfect result in their A Level during their academic year, this way a student gets the access to get all his/her queries addressed in terms of academics for their current year of education from the topper students, thereby reducing the need of private tuitions for the same, for which the parents would have paid additional money over and above their school fee.

60 - 04 Dec 2023 08:32PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: BA Psychology  *Bachelor in Psychology* is a 3-year undergraduate course.  *What is a Bachelor in Psychology course?*  In Bachelor in Psychology, students learn mainly about the processing of the human mind and human behaviour. They study how humans behave differently in different circumstances while dealing with different sets of people. On the basis of this, various conclusions are drawn.  *What is it about?*  Psychology, in simple terms, is the study of human mind and human behavior. A student of psychology has to study how a human mind works in different situations, how it develops perception, what are the various circumstances and how they affect the development of human behavior. Although psychology is introduced at school level in India, it is only at the college level when one learns the basic theories and applications related to Psychology and Psychoanalysis. Psychology courses at the undergraduate level are generally application based and prepare students for entry level jobs in related fields.  BA Psychology is ideal for students who have a leaning towards Arts and Social Sciences and are willing to take up an in-depth study of psychology.  *Career Prospects*  What can you do with a BA degree in Psychology?  The graduates of BA Psychology have a lot of opportunities ahead, both in academics and in the job sector.  *Jobs*  The graduates of this course get various opportunities to work in many different fields in both the private sector and the government sector. They get work in departments like hospitals, educational institutes, corporate organizations, etc. Some of the profiles which are open for them are Social Worker, Sales Representative, Recruiters, Teachers, etc.

116 - 02 Dec 2023 06:07AM - +263 78 806 5685: Most people assume scholarships to be like some charity that is being distributed which is not the case. It is very important to understand the current scholarship scenario. A fully funded scholarship is the dream of every African student, but continuous academic excellence is one of the most significant criteria for fully funded scholarships and only a handful of exceptionally meritorious students meet that. First of all, its important to understand that Edoofa isn't a philanthropic and charitable organization and so this $10 Million scholarship fund isn't coming from a charity which will be distributed to students. We are a social, for-profit organization which aims to help deserving students with life-changing opportunities to further their careers through affordable higher education as well as internship opportunities.RATION? Answer: Edoofa is looking for bright, meritorious and deserving students who have a passion for education and a long term vision. Students get a free career counselling session and check their eligibility. If they meet the program requirements and eligibility criteria, they are declared eligible by the Edoofa Academic Board. On completion of the program fee formalities, Edoofa Admission teams work on the students application, and statement of purpose and send the final student application along with Edoofa's recommendation to colleges and universities in India, after which the students are awarded a scholarship. counselling

17 - 04 Dec 2023 12:33PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
18 - 04 Dec 2023 12:33PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2000 students enrolled in the program. We are associated with more than 200 schools in Zimbabwe. In Manicaland we have a total of 18 Schools to name a few St. Davids Girls Bonda, Hartzell High, First Class, First Choice and so on.  Chipinge we have Chibuwe High School, you would be happy to know that the DEOs of Mutare and Chipinge have their kids under the Edoofa Scholarship. Masvingo we have 24 Schools collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools example Pamushana, St. Antonys, Reformed Church Gutu, Zaka High and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita Madam Makomeke.We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central and East) Province, Midlands Province.  Last but not the Least we also have Schools from Bulawayo and Matebaland South associated with Edoofa. Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo adds a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in a span of 14 years.  The Schools, Institutions and Educationists who have made efforts to train the students for this prestigious Scholarship Program are also the Authorized Designatories of EDOOFA in Zimbabawe. Ministry of Education), Ms. Christina Rockson (Founder and Principal of Hilltop Christian College in SA) who have shown relentless efforts to guide students on the right path to success.EDOOFA boasts a proud students and parents community of more than 2000 from Zimbabwe who are happy with the quality of education and the employability outcomes.

148 - 04 Dec 2023 08:31PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: B.Sc. Nutrition and Dietetics  *B.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics* is a 3- year long full- time undergraduate course divided over 6 semesters. It involves the study of food management, promotion of health through healthy food, and primarily focusses on the relationship between the body and food. B.Sc. in Nutrition and Dietetics essentially involves an advanced learning in ways to enhance the quality of life and overall well-being by promoting healthy diet behaviors and exploring healthier dietary modifications.  The program consists of a comprehensive curriculum that combines the science of nutrition with a broader view of wellness, community and environment, delving into reasons for unhealthy eating behaviors and ways to rectify and improve the same.  Students interested in learning about nutritional matters and food habits, and in training in health care units such as clinics, hospitals and community nutrition in close proximity of doctors, clinicians and dieticians, are best suited for a B.Sc. in Nutrition & Dietetics.  Ideal candidates would have relevant skills such as tact, team spirit and compassion, and an inherent instinct to counsel, guide, and treat patients suffering from diet- based health issues.  Nutrition and Dietetics is fast- growing both as an academic discipline and in practical application, both in India and abroad. Successful graduates of the course interested in further studies in the discipline may pursue M.Sc., M.Phil. and Ph. D in the same subject. Those interested in professionally working in the industry and find lucrative employment opportunities in private sector clinics and hospitals, or may get self-employed.  Other areas of employment include private sector organizations such as leisure cruise companies and private nursing homes. Such graduates may also choose to become psychiatric nursing as a profession where they work with patients suffering from emotional and psychological distress caused from unhealthy diet patterns.

24 - 04 Dec 2023 01:10PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees. Over the past 6 years, we have worked with 250+ Universities in India and have a community of more than 4000 students from different African countries. We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. For more than 50,000 applications there are just 5000 scholarship seats which denote the intense competition and the strict eligibility process to find deserving students and *make education, not just affordable and accessible to them but also employability driven so that Edoofians become future leaders in their domains!*
25 - 04 Dec 2023 01:10PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Speaking specifically about Zimbabwe, we have more than 2000 students enrolled in the program. We are associated with more than 200 schools in Zimbabwe. Some of the most elite Schools in Zimbabawe example in Harare we are collaborated with St. Dominics Chishawasha, Dominican Convent, Christ Ministries and many others. In Manicaland we have a total of 18 Schools to name a few St. Davids Girls Bonda, Hartzell High, First Class, First Choice and so on.  Chipinge we have Chibuwe High School, you would be happy to know that the DEOs of Mutare and Chipinge have their kids under the Edoofa Scholarship. Masvingo we have 24 Schools collaborated with over 300 students from some of the best schools example Pamushana, St. Antonys, Reformed Church Gutu, Zaka High and many others. The program is also appreciated by the Education Inspector of Bikita Madam Makomeke.We have more than 500 students from Mashonaland (West, Central and East) Province, Midlands Province.  Last but not the Least we also have Schools from Bulawayo and Matebaland South associated with Edoofa. Our collaborations with the UCE College Bulawayo adds a feather to the Cap of trust that Edoofa has built in a span of 14 years.  The Schools, Institutions and Educationists who have made efforts to train the students for this prestigious Scholarship Program are also the Authorized Designatories of EDOOFA in Zimbabawe. We have Mr. Shorwi Kawadza (Retd. Headmaster Hartzell), Mr. Charles Jerera (Retd. Ministry of Education), Ms. Christina Rockson (Founder and Principal of Hilltop Christian College in SA) who have shown relentless efforts to guide students on the right path to success.EDOOFA boasts a proud students and parents community of more than 2000 from Zimbabwe who are happy with the quality of education and the employability outcomes.
26 - 04 Dec 2023 01:10PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Your application has been shortlisted for this prestigious opportunity and we expect you to go through all the above information, be transparent and active throughout the counseling session and Evaluation  So shall we start the session?

90 - 04 Dec 2023 04:42PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Physiotherapy *Physiotherapy* is a branch of healthcare that applies modes of physical movement such as exercise, massage, besides education, advice, and counselling services to circumstances where movement and function are threatened by ageing, pain, injury, diseases, disorders, conditions, or other environmental factors.  Students enrolled to the course are taught on an advanced level about core physiotherapeutic skills such as manual therapy, therapeutic exercises, and application of electro-physical modalities, which have been proven to cure a range of disabilities and disease related to spine, back, neck, and even stress-related incontinence.  Bachelor of Physiotherapy is a 4-year undergraduate course, including compulsory 6 months of clinical internship, and involving the science of physical movement aimed at preventing disease and disability.  The opportunities for a career in Physiotherapy are excellent, whether in the public health system, private practice or non-government organisations. Career pathways include the disciplines and areas of:  *Healthcare Management* *Industrial Rehabilitation* *Research & Academics* *Special Schools* *Multinational companies for fitness of their employers*

99 - 04 Dec 2023 02:49PM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: BSc Cardiovascular Technology  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology* is a 3-year degree program that deals with diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the heart and the circulatory system.  In this program, students will get familiar with various complex procedures such as performing stent implants, setting up cardiac pacemakers and defibrillators in the treatment of heart diseases.  The BSc Cardiovascular Technology syllabus includes subjects such as Human Anatomy, Cardiovascular System, Physiology, Pathology, Electrocardiography and Echocardiography.  BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders will be able to find work in various sectors such as Hospitals, Universities, Health organizations etc.  They may also serve as Cardiovascular Technician, Cardiovascular Technologist, Medical Sonographer, etc. Graduates have the opportunity to work in India or Abroad to pursue graduate studies and to get involved in research activities.  After completing this course, students can pursue higher studies and advanced academic exploration along with research through MSc and Certificate Courses. Students can also pursue MBA, PGDM courses. These courses essentially provides a solid basis for further studies and related prospects.  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology: What is it about?* Read the points given below to know what BSc Cardiovascular Technology course is all about:  BSc in Cardiovascular Technology deals with various topics on the vascular or the circulatory system. Through this course, one gets to learn about the arteries, veins and the blood vessels that carry blood throughout the human body. These blood vessels are also instrumental in delivering oxygen and essential nutrients to the body tissues.  With the help of this course one gets to learn about the various cardiovascular diseases that affect the human body.   This course also helps a cardiovascular technologist or technician to learn about the various procedures and tests while assisting the physician in diagnosing and treating a patient ailing from heart disease. Some of the complex procedures that a student learns in this course are implanting of stents and setting up a pacemaker. They learn through this course, both invasive  as well as non-invasive procedures in the treatment of heart diseases.  *Why Should You Study a BSc Cardiovascular Technology course?*  BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a prestigious and popular stream of study in the field of allied health sciences. This field of study has a lot of importance and applications as it concerns directly with the treatment of heart diseases. Let us see here some of the reasons why one should study B.Sc Cardiovascular Technology.  With more and more people suffering from heart diseases because of many factors including lifestyle, genetics and environment, the importance of this field of study is ever increasing. Cardiologists and other heart surgeons greatly depend upon the services and support of cardiovascular technologists and technicians for carrying out various complex procedures on patients suffering from heart ailments.   With congenital heart diseases too on the rise, that is those that are prevalent in patients from birth itself, there is an increased awareness among different walks of people about the risks associated with such heart diseases. This in turn, further brings the field in limelight, as people are more likely to avail the services of a cardiovascular technologist. The numerous advances in the medical field in this domain has been a boon for patients and the medical fraternity alike. With rapid advances in the field, the services are getting more and more affordable, with many availing such services.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death  gather resolution from despair but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be: a) The Change of Nature b) The Will to Fight c) Courage and Panic d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . 328 - 04 Dec 2023 06:52PM - +263 78 092 6205: Section 1  Bradley Aldridge Junior Weale Male Aldridge Weale Patience Mawuka bajweale@gmail.com apweale2@gmail.com B-tech mechanical engineering 2024 Zimbabwe  Section 2  1. D 2. C 3. A 4. C 5. B   Section 3   6. D 7. A 8. A 9. C   Section 4   10. D 11. A 12. B 13. C 14. B 15. D 16. B   Section 5   The Rwandan Genocide, a bloody and horrific period that took place in Rwanda from April to July 1994. An estimated 800000 Tutsi and Hutu tribe members were killed by Hutu extremists. The economy was in ruins and infrastructure had been destroyed. The country began a process of recovery and reconstruction with a focus on reconsolidation and unity amount the Hutu and Tutsi tribes. Significant efforts were made to improve the economy and infrastructure and to to promote peace and stability. New infrastructure was built including roads bridges and public buildings. Many of these projects were funded by international Aid Organisations including the World bank and the United Nations. One of the most notable projects was the construction of the Kigali Construction Centre which was completed in 2010. Other notable buildings include the Gisozi Genocide Memorial Centre and the Kigali International Airport. These projects have helped to improve the quality of life for Rwandans and to promote economic development in the country.  Despite it's troubled history Rwanda has become a beacon of hope to ather African countries in the areas of economic development, poverty reduction, gender equality and good governance. Under the leadership of president Paul Kegame, the country has achieved impressive economic growth rates, reduced poverty levels and increased access to basic services. Rwanda has made significant progress in promoting gender equality with women making over 60% of it's parliament. In addition Rwanda has been praised for it's efforts to combat corruption and improve transparency.  Since the genocide, Rwanda has made significant progress in primary, secondary and tertiary education. They have made strides in improving the quality of education with a focus on teacher's training and improving learning environments. The country has seen an increase in the number of students pursuing higher education with the Rwandan Government investing in both public and private universities. The Rwandan health system has undergone a dramatic transformation since the genocide. They have made investments in the health sector with a focus on primary health care. The life expectancy has increased from 48 in 2000 to 68 in recent years and infant mortality has also declined from 121 deaths to 29 deaths per 1000 live births. Rwanda has also made improvements in it's sports sector. They have invested in infrastructure, including construction of new sports stadiums and the development of sports facilities. The country has also seen success on the international stage with athletes from Rwanda competing in events such as the Olympics and The African Games  These achievements have made Rwanda a model for other African countries looking to emulate it's success.  Section 6  My inspirational story is that of former United States President  Barack Obama. He was born as a normal black child in Hawaii with a white American mother and a black Kenyan father and somehow he managed to become the first black president of the United States Of America  Growing up when he was just two years old his family moved Indonesia when his father got a job offer there and this inspires me because my dad also has to move from Zimbabwe to Mozambique so that he could take care of us. Barack moved back to the States after four years and I believe this had an impact on his life as he was immersed into different cultures and I believe this shaped his views upon life as well as his future political views.  After finishing his high school he got scholarships and student loans so that he could finance his tertiary university as he went to a college in California and studied political sciences. After two years he transfered to Columbia University in New York City. Years later he to Harvard Law School and he furthered his studies. Education played a huge role in Obama's success and this is one of the reasons why I find education important to my life.  Obama's political career started slowly as he was elected as a democrat to the Illinois Senate and he served eight years. He was later on elected as the United States Senate in 2004 and served for another four years before running for President and winning in 2008. He was re-elected again in 2012 and served another successful term.  Barack Obama's story is very inspirational to me because against the odds he managed to conquer and lead one of the strongest nations on earth. He became president despite all the set backs, humble beginnings and the obvious racial segregation. He went against the odds and and I intend to do the same in order to make it and be successful. Barack Obama will go down in history as one of the best Presidents of America and he is my inspiration.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death  gather resolution from despair but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be: a) The Change of Nature b) The Will to Fight c) Courage and Panic d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . What are they? a) He may be paralyzed with fear, run away or fight. b) He may flee in panic, or fight back or stand still. c) He may be paralyzed with fear, or seized with panic, or as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, and face the danger. d) He may be paralyzed with fear, seized with panic or act like an inferior animal.  3.What is the meaning of the word debilitating ? a) enfeeble b) thriving c) strengthen d) debase  4. Explain the phrase gather resolution from danger. a) Find peace in times of difficulty. b) To remain calm and not to lose hope. c) A state of utter hopelessness makes one determined to face the difficulty. d) To be enthusiastic and brave the odds.  5. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because a) He felt elated as he was alive. b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time. c) They brought him a new experience. d) These experiences boosted his confidence. The country has made significant progress in terms of economic development, infrastructure, and social stability. The country has also made a strong commitment to reconciliation and justice, with a focus on building a society based on shared values of peace, unity, and reconciliation. Today, Rwanda is considered one of the safest countries in Africa and has seen rapid economic growth. However, the country still faces challenges related to poverty, inequality, and unemployment. But overall, the past 16 years have seen Rwanda move from a place of great tragedy to one of hope and progress.   Section 6 Another inspiring story is that of a girl named Rachel. When Rachel was 10 years old, her mother passed away from a terminal illness. This left Rachel feeling lost and alone. But with the help of her father and community, she was able to find the strength to move forward. She worked hard to stay on top of her schoolwork and became a role model for other children who had lost parents. Today, Rachel is a successful young woman who is pursuing her dreams with the same determination and resilience that got her through her mother's death.

177 - 04 Dec 2023 04:35PM - Shubham Madhwal: The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on students performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing  just to name a few.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death  gather resolution from despair but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The title that best suits the passage would be: a) The Change of Nature b) The Will to Fight c) Courage and Panic d) The Miracle of Confronting Danger  2.A man may react to sudden danger in three different ways . What are they? a) He may be paralyzed with fear, run away or fight. b) He may flee in panic, or fight back or stand still. c) He may be paralyzed with fear, or seized with panic, or as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, and face the danger. d) He may be paralyzed with fear, seized with panic or act like an inferior animal.  3.What is the meaning of the word debilitating ? a) enfeeble b) thriving c) strengthen d) debase  4. Explain the phrase gather resolution from danger. a) Find peace in times of difficulty. b) To remain calm and not to lose hope. c) A state of utter hopelessness makes one determined to face the difficulty. d) To be enthusiastic and brave the odds.  5. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because a) He felt elated as he was alive. b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time. c) They brought him a new experience. d) These experiences boosted his confidence. 333 - 04 Dec 2023 07:01PM - +263 77 459 4818: Lo-rraine Munashe Mutema Female 28 September 2005 Hardlife Lazarus Mutema Vhunzai Mutema lorrainemutema969@gmail.com vhunzaimachingauta@gmail.com Business Administration August 2024 Zimbabwe   Section 2  1.(a)the change of nature 2.(c)He may be paralyzed with fear,or seized with panic,or as if by miracle,become possesed of necessary courage and face the danger 3.(a) enfeeble 4.(c)a state of utter or hopelessness makes one dertemined to face the difficulty 5.(b)they added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time   Section 3  6.(c) out perform 7(a)no change 8.(c)scientists,and 9.(d)after sentence 3  Section 4  10.(d)x=10 11.(a)-1+22i 12.(b)Kathy starts each week with 108 phones to fix 13.(b)(3,-8) 14.(b)(3,-8) 15(c)(7,7) 16(b)2  Rwanda story  Title : Rebuilding hope:Life in Rwanda 16 years after the  Genocide  Rwanda a country nestled in the heart of East Africa ,faced an unimaginable tragedy in 1994-the genocide that claimed the lives of nearly a million people in just 100 days.Today,16 years after that dark period in it's history,Rwsnda has emerged as a symbol of resilience, reconciliation,and remarkable progress.  After math of genocide left the nation shattered ,both physically and emotionally.Entire communities were torn apart, families were destroyed,and the country was lefts in ruins.Rebuilding seemed like an insurmountable challenge,yet Rwanda embarked in ajourney of healing that has become an inspiring global example.  Economically ,Rwanda has experienced significant growth and development.The gorvenment has invested in infrastructure , education,and health care,leading to improved living standards for the citizens.The capital ,Kigali stands as a testament to the nations progress ,with morden buildings and a growing technology sector and a bustling economy.  In terms of international relations ,Rwanda is actively engaged with global community.The nation participates in peace keeping missions,contributes to regional community and has become a vocal advocate for African development.  The resilience and progress of Rwanda provide a valuable lesson for the world-a lesson of hope, forgiveness and the possibility of rebuilding even the most broken societies.The nation's commitment to unity, economic development and education serves as beacon of inspiration demonstrating that even in the face of unspeakable tragedy ,a nation can rise from the ashes and build a brighter future.  As Rwanda continues it's journey of recovery,the international community must remain engaged providing support and collaboration.The story of Rwanda is o ne of transformation ,and it's people examplify the strength of human spirit in the  face of adversity.The lesson learned from Rwanda's  post- genocide experience can save as a blueprint for other nations grappling with aftermath of conflict, offering  a pathway to healing and renewed hope for a better tommorow.

121 - 02 Dec 2023 01:15PM - Shubham Madhwal: *Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communications (B.J.M.C)* is a 3-year duration undergraduate program for students who wish to pursue their career in Journalism and media industry.  The Career Options and Job opportunities are very high with the media sector. A student who has completed B.J.M.C can work with the news channels, news magazines, publication houses, Media is a connection between the population and the world. It is an important source by which anybody can get information at the same time and at different places. B.J.M.C course is the source to makeover the skills of students as a journalism or reporter to make aware the public with the current affairs.  After the successfully completion of this course, students will be able to develop their skills of gathering and transmitting the data and information and deliver it to the audience or population to make them aware what is going around the world.  BJMC Syllabus enables the students to present the news in such a way which will be easy for the public to understand. Writing, reporting, news presentation, news editing are activities of journalist and mass communicator.  There are so many individuals who have interest in storytelling, audio-video, blogging & web content writing and most importantly interacting with more and more people in the world. Such kind of individuals should opt for this course as this course may fulfill their desire and passion as well.  The one who opt for B.J.M.C course should have critical thinking ability, analytical skills, interpretation skills, good communication skills and convincing power ability also.
